caption:
This photograph captures a rural scene of agricultural activity set in a picturesque mountain landscape. A large, green tractor is at the center of the image, pulling behind it an agricultural implement, likely a baler, which is processing freshly cut hay. The tractor is operated by a person wearing a short-sleeved shirt and a baseball cap, actively engaged with the machinery.

The surrounding landscape features rolling hills and lush greenery, indicative of a fertile valley. The background is dominated by steep, rocky hills that suggest the area is likely near mountainous terrain. Between the hills, a clear blue sky with fluffy white clouds provides a vivid contrast to the predominantly green and brown colors of the terrain.

On the left part of the background, just across from the working field, there are some farm structures, possibly barns or storage sheds, characteristic of rural farmland infrastructure. The farmhouses and hay bales, scattered around the field, emphasize the agricultural nature of the region.

The image conveys a sense of tranquility and the timeless nature of farming life, emphasizing the connection between the land and agricultural practices. The machinery and the vast expanse of the field highlight human intervention in nature, a theme often found in imagery depicting rural and agricultural landscapes.
title: Three generations of oldlands have ranched on piceance creek.  In the summer they move 15 miles south to their cow camp, and their cattle graze on higher lands owned by the bureau of lamb management and private oil companies
